title: Analytical connections to Precalculus part - d

content.description: Let f be the function given by <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>.
content.question:
Find the range of f. Use f ′(x) to justify your answer.

Note: f ′(x)= x+2 / (x2+x+1)3/2

frqParts.text:

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema
